main event: A witness reported a sighting of a bright object that appeared to grow in size and intensity before disappearing behind clouds.
interesting points: The sighting occurred on November 18, 1959, at 19:05 E.S.T.,The object was reported as having an irregular shape, possibly round and very bright,The object was observed for about 5 minutes and moved in a circular fashion,The witness estimated the object to be 35 to 40 feet in diameter,There was debate among observers whether it could be classified as a balloon or meteor.
witness description: witnesses provided detailed observations and sketches of the object's movement
